info.title: enfore Contacts API
info.description:
enfore API for managing contacts (incl. customers and suppliers)

Contacts are entities that the organization has dealings with.
Contacts can be split into individual contacts (i.e., human persons) and organization contacts (i.e., other organizations/businesses).
Additionally, contacts can have roles such as being a supplier or a customer. A single contact can have multiple roles. I.e., a supplier can also be a customer.

tags.name: Individual Contacts
tags.description: Individual contacts are private persons that the organization has dealings with.

tags.name: Organization Contacts
tags.description: Organization contacts are businesses and other organizations that the organization has dealings with.

get.summary: Load all individual contacts from an organization

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Max number of objects to be returned per page.
Note that both the `items` as well as the `problems` arrays of the query response count towards this number to allow a simple,
consistent paging over all items (and problems) of a given timeframe.
If not given, defaults to `200`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset of items and problems of where to start the next page.
Similar to limit and offset in SQL, one would obtain the second page with `limit=10&offset=10`.
Note that this paging with limit and offset is within a time interval that is specified with `from` and `to`.
If not given, defaults to `0`.

items.description: The individual contacts contained in the sequence
Represents a human person.

problems.description: Any problems that occurred when handling the query

type.description: A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.
Note that this is not specific to the specific problem occurrence but only depends on the type.
Target audience is developers using the API, not suitable for display to end users.

detail.description:
A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
Target audience is developers using the API, not suitable for display to end users.

on_resource.description: URI of the resource for which the error occurred.

items.description:
A problem that occurred while processing an API request.
This is based on problem+json as defined in [RFC7807](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807)
Will have a textual message that is intended for use by developers using the API and not usable for display to end users.
If the error occurred as part of operating on a specific resource, the object may provide the URI idenifying that object.

get.summary: Load an IndividualContact with Subresources by its identifier

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: contact-id
parameters.description: ID of the contact

full_address.description: The full address as a string suitable for display to an end user.

items.description: An address of a location/destination

organization_contact.description: The ID of the OrganizationContact that the IndividualContact owning the ProfessionalIdentity represents.

departments.description:
The departments of the represented organization that the person works at.
The array contains the IDs which reference Department items that belong to the OrganizationContact referenced by the PIs "organization_contact" field.

locations.description:
The locations of the represented organization that the person works at.
The array contains the IDs which reference Location items that belong to the OrganizationContact referenced by the PIs "organization_contact" field.

professional_identity.description: A professional identity represents that an individual contact represents (e.g., works for) an organization.

full_address.description: The full address as a string suitable for display to an end user.

items.description: An address of a location/destination
A ProfessionalIdentity including all subresources such addresses, emails and phones.

added.description: Date time is of format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' and always UTC. Be aware that 'T' and 'Z' are constants and hours are in 24 hour format.

organization_contact.description: The ID of the OrganizationContact that the IndividualContact owning the ProfessionalIdentity represents.

departments.description:
The departments of the represented organization that the person works at.
The array contains the IDs which reference Department items that belong to the OrganizationContact referenced by the PIs "organization_contact" field.

locations.description:
The locations of the represented organization that the person works at.
The array contains the IDs which reference Location items that belong to the OrganizationContact referenced by the PIs "organization_contact" field.

professional_identity.description: A professional identity represents that an individual contact represents (e.g., works for) an organization.

full_address.description: The full address as a string suitable for display to an end user.

items.description: An address of a location/destination

schema.description: A ProfessionalIdentity including all subresources such addresses, emails and phones.

get.summary: Load all organization contacts from an organization

parameters.name: org-id
parameters.description: ID of the organization whose data is being accessed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Max number of objects to be returned per page.
Note that both the `items` as well as the `problems` arrays of the query response count towards this number to allow a simple,
consistent paging over all items (and problems) of a given timeframe.
If not given, defaults to `200`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Offset of items and problems of where to start the next page.
Similar to limit and offset in SQL, one would obtain the second page with `limit=10&offset=10`.
Note that this paging with limit and offset is within a time interval that is specified with `from` and `to`.
If not given, defaults to `0`.
